intro: Canthium sechellense, commonly known as the Seychelles spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Seychellen archipelago. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat. It has small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
